info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 10 at 6:44PM EDT until July 10 at 10:15PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley and Charleston. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 631 PM EDT, showers and thunderstorms producing heavy rainfall were located across Downtown Charleston and into portions of Mount Pleasant. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen across portions of West Ashely and North Charleston, with 4 to 6 inches across portions of Daniel Island and Mount Pleasant. High tide has peaked, however flood waters will be slow to drain. Rain rates will start to decrease around 7 PM. Rapid rises have been observed at Church Creek near West Ashely. As of 735 PM water levels were measuring just shy of 5 feet and rising. Flood stage is 5.5 feet. Emergency Management and broadcast media have reported numerous road closures in Downtown Charleston due to flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Mount Pleasant, Goose Creek, Hanahan, West Ashley, Downtown Charleston, James Island, I-26/I-526 Interchange, Johns Island, Daniel Island, Fort Sumter, Hollywood, Isle Of Palms, Folly Beach, Ravenel, Sullivan`s Island, Meggett, Charles Towne Landing, Maybank Bridge and James Island County Park.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Heavy rain in Downtown Charleston will result in nuisance flooding of low-lying areas. Areas most prone to flooding include the Market, Crosstown, East Bay Street and Morrison Drive. Slow down when traveling and allow extra distance between you and the vehicle ahead. Do not drive into water of unknown depth.
